items.headline: Biden Says Opted Against White House Bid Because He Couldn't Win

headlines.web: Biden Says Opted Against White House Bid Because He Couldn't Win

items.summary: U.S. Vice President Joe Biden said he decided not to make a 2016 run for the White House  after concluding he couldn’t, so late in the game, put together a campaign that would derail Democratic frontrunner Hillary Clinton.

items.headline: Trump, Carson Tied in Iowa; Trump Leads in N.H.: CBS News Poll

headlines.web: Trump, Carson Tied in Iowa; Trump Leads in N.H.: CBS News Poll

items.summary: Donald Trump and Ben Carson are tied with 27% support in Iowa, and Ted Cruz has 12%, among likely Republican caucus voters, compared with a slight lead Trump had in September, CBS News says in its latest Battleground Tracker poll. Trump has 38% support among likely GOP primary voters in New Hampshire, compared with 12% for Carson; the margin is similar to the lead Trump had in Sept., CBS says In SC, Trump leads with 40% vs 23% for Carson Among likely Republican caucus voters in Iowa, Carson has

items.headline: Ben Carson: Ban Abortion, No Exceptions for Rape or Incest

headlines.web: Ben Carson: Ban Abortion, No Exceptions for Rape or Incest

items.summary: Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson would like abortion to be outlawed in the United States.

items.headline: Christie: Obama Encourages 'Lawlessness' By Supporting Black Lives Matter

headlines.web: Christie: Obama Encourages 'Lawlessness' By Supporting Black Lives Matter

items.summary: Republican presidential candidate Chris Christie on Sunday said president Barack Obama spurs "lawlessness" through his support of the Black Lives Matter movement.

items.headline: Get our newsletter
John Podesta: 'Massive Difference' Between Clinton and Petraeus

headlines.web: John Podesta: 'Massive Difference' Between Clinton and Petraeus

items.summary: John Podesta, the campaign chairman for 2016 Democratic presidential front-runner Hillary Clinton, on Sunday said there's a clear difference between former CIA director David Petraeus giving information to his girlfriend, and Clinton e-mailing possibly classified material to her daughter Chelsea.

items.headline: Donald Trump: Benghazi Hearing Showed ‘Unbelievable’ Partisan Hatred

headlines.web: Donald Trump: Benghazi Hearing Showed ‘Unbelievable’ Partisan Hatred

items.summary: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said on Sunday that Thursday's Benghazi committee hearing showed escalating partisan hatred, and repeated a claim that the world would be better off with dictators like Saddam Hussein still in power.

items.headline: Republicans Want Outsider Candidate, Trump as Best Shot: AP Poll

headlines.web: Republicans Want Outsider Candidate, Trump as Best Shot: AP Poll

items.summary: Donald Trump is seen by Republican voters as having best shot of winning U.S. presidential election, AP-GfK poll says. 7 out of 10 committed GOP, Republican-leaning voters say Trump could win in ’16 if nominated, while 6 out of 10 say Ben Carson has the best chance, AP says Jeb Bush garners 60% support from GOP voters who say he could win election, while U.S. Senator Marco Rubio is given a 54% chance of winning by Republican voters: AP 77% of GOP voters polled wanted “outsider” candidate instead

items.headline: Ben Carson Tells Donald Trump ‘I Have Plenty of Energy’

headlines.web: Ben Carson Tells Donald Trump ‘I Have Plenty of Energy’

items.summary: Ben Carson, newly minted frontrunner for the Iowa Republican presidential caucus, is pushing back against criticism from billionaire Donald Trump that he is “super low energy.”

items.headline: Bush’s Response to Reports of Campaign Cutbacks: ‘Blah, Blah’

headlines.web: Bush’s Response to Reports of Campaign Cutbacks: ‘Blah, Blah’

items.summary: “Blah, blah, blah,” Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush said Saturday in South Carolina when addressing speculation about recent financial cutbacks to his campaign, according to USA Today. “That’s my answer — blah, blah, blah,” the former Florida gov. added. RELATED: Jeb Bush Orders Across-the-Board Pay Cuts for Struggling Campaign

items.headline: Strategist David Plouffe Endorses Hillary Clinton

headlines.web: Strategist David Plouffe Endorses Hillary Clinton

items.summary: The political strategist wrote Saturday on Medium that Clinton would be “a president who will wake up every day, prepared to overcome any obstacle on their behalf.” NOTE: Plouffe managed then-Sen. Barack Obama’s 2008 run for president, helping Obama beat Clinton in Democratic nomination race

items.headline: Trump Doesn't Believe Polls Showing He's No. 2

headlines.web: Trump Doesn't Believe Polls Showing He's No. 2

items.summary: Donald Trump, who has spent most of the summer leading the Republican presidential field in the polls, told a Miami rally Friday he isn't buying the results of two recent surveys that show him falling into second place in the state that will kick off the voting in 2016.

items.summary: Republican presidential candidate Dr. Ben Carson told Mark Halperin and John Heilemann that he worries secret service protection would limit his interaction with people. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.summary: In an interview with Mark Halperin and John Heilemann, Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz, who was born in Canada, weighs in on the baseball playoff series between the Kansas City Royals and the Toronto Blue Jays. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.headline: Jeb Bush Says Presidential Campaign Is Going ‘Lean and Mean’

headlines.web: Jeb Bush Says Presidential Campaign Is Going ‘Lean and Mean’

items.summary: Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush says report on Friday that he’s imposing across-the-board pay cuts and removing some senior staff members is necessary move for his campaign to adjust to evolving circumstances. “This means lean and mean and it means that I have the ability to adapt. And the circumstances when we started the election were different” Bush says he’s “all in” in early primary states, incl. Va. “Every dollar we can save in overhead is a dollar that goes on television, goes

items.headline: Obama Compares Republican Politicians to ‘Grumpy Cat’

headlines.web: Obama Compares Republican Politicians to ‘Grumpy Cat’

items.summary: “You listen to them, and they’ve constructed this entire separate reality,” President Obama says at a DNC Women’s Leadership Forum. “Why is it Republican politicians are so down on America?” Obama asks. “They’re like Grumpy Cat” Obama says he will back whoever becomes the Democratic nominee and was proud of all Democrats who participated in the debate last week Says current system is rewarding those who say the most outrageous things and not those “rolling up their sleeves”

items.headline: Jeb Bush to Meet With Super-PAC Donors in Houston

headlines.web: Jeb Bush to Meet With Super-PAC Donors in Houston

items.summary: Meeting will happen Sunday in Houston, where GOP presidential candidate Bush is also meeting top fundraisers for his campaign, according to three people who requested anonymity to speak about a private meeting. Former Presidents George W. Bush and George H.W. Bush, Jeb Bush’s brother and father, will be in Houston for private receptions with campaign donors, but will not attend the meeting with Right to Rise USA, the super-PAC supporting Bush’s campaign NOTE: Federal law prohibits candidates fro

items.headline: Democrats to Stay on Benghazi Committee After Clinton Testimony

headlines.web: Democrats to Stay on Benghazi Committee After Clinton Testimony

lede.caption: Representative Adam Smith, a Democrat from Washington, right, questions Hillary Clinton during a House Select Committee on Benghazi hearing in Washington on Oct. 22, 2015.
lede.credit: Representative Adam Smith, a Democrat from Washington, right, questions Hillary Clinton during a House Select Committee on Benghazi hearing in Washington on Oct. 22, 2015.

items.summary: Democrats will stay on the U.S. House Benghazi committee even though they accuse Republicans of politicizing the investigation in a partisan attempt to undermine Hillary Clinton’s presidential candidacy.

items.headline: Clinton Campaign: Record Fundraising Hour After Benghazi Hearing

headlines.web: Clinton Campaign: Record Fundraising Hour After Benghazi Hearing

items.summary: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton set record hour of fundraising from 9-10 p.m. ET Thursday after Clinton’s marathon testimony to House Benghazi committee, campaign says. Campaign says it didn’t solicit donations More than half Thursday’s donations were from new donors, 99% $250 or less, campaign says Campaign says it now has more than half-million donors

items.headline: Clinton Embraces Obama After Sanders Suggests Need for Break

headlines.web: Clinton Embraces Obama After Sanders Suggests Need for Break

items.summary: Democrat Hillary Clinton says at Virginia rally that as president, she would “build on the progress we’ve made under President Obama.” Otherwise, Clinton says, “we’re going to give Republicans another chance to tear down everything we’ve worked so hard to build” Comes after rival Bernie Sanders said Wednesday his presidency would be a “course correction” to Obama’s Clinton says 2005 bill she opposed in Senate to limit liaibility for gun manufacturers and sellers was “basically an NRA gift” NOTE:

items.headline: Schweitzer Endorses O’Malley for President, Campaign Says

headlines.web: Schweitzer Endorses O’Malley for President, Campaign Says

items.summary: “Martin and I worked closely together as Democratic Governors, and I saw firsthand how he didn’t just talk about his progressive values—he actually put them into action,” Former Gov. Brian Schweitzer, D-Mont., says in statement endorsing Martin O’Malley. “Martin and I don’t agree on every issue, but he is the only candidate with a proven record of getting things done, and I believe he is the best candidate to take on Republicans in November 2016” NOTE: Schweitzer is longtime Hillary Clinton crit

items.headline: Ben Carson Reacts to His Lead in Iowa Polls

headlines.web: Ben Carson Reacts to His Lead in Iowa Polls

lede.caption: Bloomberg's Mark Halperin and John Heilemann sit down with Republican presidential candidate Dr. Ben Carson to get his take on being the new frontrunner in Iowa and how he might handle Donald Trump. The full interview will air Friday on "With All Due Respect" at 5 p.m. ET. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.headline: Labor Union AFSCME Endorses Hillary Clinton

headlines.web: Labor Union AFSCME Endorses Hillary Clinton

items.summary: American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees says two-thirds of its 1.6m members would vote for Hillary Clinton in Democratic primary election, according to e-mail stmt. Related: Clinton Receives National Education Association Endorsement

items.headline: House to Weigh U.S. Debt Limit Increase as Deadline Nears

headlines.web: House to Weigh U.S. Debt Limit Increase as Deadline Nears

lede.caption: The U.S. Capitol Building stands on Oct. 3, 2014.

items.summary: The House of Representatives plans to consider legislation next week to raise the U.S. debt limit as Republicans negotiate over the bill with Democrats, who insist that it be free of unrelated policy provisions.

items.headline: Jeb Bush Orders Campaign Pay Cuts: What's It Signal?

headlines.web: Jeb Bush Orders Campaign Pay Cuts: What's It Signal?

lede.caption: Jeb Bush, once a front-runner for the Republican presidential nomination, is implementing an across-the-board pay cut for his struggling campaign as he attempts to regain traction just 100 days before the party’s first nominating contest. Bloomberg Politics' Steve Yaccino reports on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.summary: Jeb Bush, once a front-runner for the Republican presidential nomination, is implementing an across-the-board pay cut for his struggling campaign as he attempts to regain traction just 100 days before the party’s first nominating contest. Bloomberg Politics' Steve Yaccino reports on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)
